title: Israel Even-Zahav
text:
Israel Even-Zahav () is a former <a href="Paralympic">Paralympic</a> athlete from <a href="Israel">Israel</a>.
Even-Zahav was affected by <a href="polio">polio</a> at a young age. In the 1960s he began practicing in <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a>, <a href="archery">archery</a> and <a href="wheelchair%20basketball">wheelchair basketball</a> at the <a href="Israel%20Sports%20Center%20for%20the%20Disabled">Israel Sports Center for the Disabled</a> in <a href="Ramat%20Gan">Ramat Gan</a>.
A member of the national delegation to the <a href="1964%20Summer%20Paralympics">1964 Summer Paralympics</a>, Even-Zahav finished fifth in the <a href="discus%20throw">discus throw</a> competition and was a member of the gold-medal winning <a href="wheelchair%20basketball">wheelchair basketball</a> team. He was also a member of the wheelchair basketball team in the <a href="1968%20Summer%20Paralympics">1968 Summer Paralympics</a>, also winning a silver medal in athletics (<a href="discus">Discus throw</a>) and taking part in <a href="shot%20put">shot put</a>, <a href="club%20throw">club throw</a> and <a href="archery">archery</a> competitions.
He married fellow athlete <a href="Neora%20Helsinger">Neora Helsinger</a> in 1967 .
